resources.string: S A D B O Y S
Visit Oracle\'s website and download the JDK that matches your OS and version if Windows
Run the downloaded executable file to install the JDK

Navigate to Environment Varaiblesâ€¦ 

Windows 7: Computer > System Properties > Advanced System Settings > Environment Variables 

Windows 8: Settings > PC Info > Advanced Settings > Environment Variables 

 Under System variables, find the variables JAVA_HOME and Path. 
(If it doesn't exist, create one) 

Add a semicolon(;) and the jdk's bin path to both of the variable's values. 
(By default it should be "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_45\bin")>
